required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Omega-3 Supplementation on Muscle Functioning, Inflammation and Muscle Signaling
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Omega-3 Supplementation on Muscle Functioning, Inflammation and Muscle Signaling in Elderly

brief_summary.textblock: Elderly are supplemented with either Omega-3 (3 x 1.1g per day) or placebo (corn oil) during 14 weeks. The last 12 weeks, supplementation is combined with resistance exercise training (3x per week) focusing on upper leg strength. In the present project, the investigators study whether differences in muscle strength and/or muscle mass between conditions can be explained by omega-3-induced effects on systemic or muscle inflammatory signaling, or differences in muscle molecular signaling.

detailed_description.textblock: Elderly are supplemented with either Omega-3 (3 x 1.1g per day) or placebo (corn oil) during 14 weeks. The last 12 weeks, supplementation is combined with resistance exercise training (3x per week) focusing on upper leg strength. In the present project, the investigators study whether differences in muscle strength and/or muscle mass between conditions can be explained by omega-3-induced effects on systemic or muscle inflammatory signaling, or differences in muscle molecular signaling.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Elderly humans (>65y) are randomized to a placebo or omega-3 group (interventions, tests, analyses etc. are executed in parallel).
study_design_info.masking_description: Subjects are a priori randomized to one of both conditions. Both groups undergo an identical intervention, but receive different supplements (although appearance-matched). The investigators do not know in which condition the subjects are randomized. One researcher, who is not involved in the intervention/data collection/data analyses, holds the code.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in muscle strength between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
primary_outcome.description: Isometric muscle strength as assessed with Biodex Device in Nm

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in inflammatory signaling between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
primary_outcome.description: Systemic (blood) markers of inflammation: hs-CRP (mg/L), IL-6 (pg/mL), TNFa (pg/mL)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in muscle strength between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
primary_outcome.description: One Repetition Maximum on the leg press fitness device in kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in muscle quality between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle molecular signaling (Protein levels of anabolic/catabolic signaling and skeletal muscle stress)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in muscle molecular signaling between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Biochemical analyses of muscle biopsies obtained pre-post intervention in both conditions. This involves parameters of muscle anabolism, catabolism, stress, structure, integrity, quality etc.: mTORC1 pathway, FoXO, MAPK (western blotting technique, values expressed as arbitrary units)

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in handgrip strength between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
other_outcome.description: Handgrip strength measured by a dynamometer (results in kg)

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in timed up-and-go test performance between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
other_outcome.description: Timed-up-and-go: time needed to stand up from a chair, walk 3m, turn, walk back and sit down.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in sit-to-stand test performance between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
other_outcome.description: Sit-to-stand: the amount of repetitions that one can complete during 30 sec and the time needed to complete 5 sit-to-stands.

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in fat% between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
Change in lean mass% between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
Change in basal metabolic rate between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
Change in muscle volume between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
other_outcome.description: Muscle Volume in a 2-cm CT-scan slice (4 slices of 5mm)

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in Mean Muscle Hounsfield Unit between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
other_outcome.description: Muscle Hounsfield Unit serves as a marker of muscle quality

other_outcome.time_frame: Change in sleep quality between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)
Change inperceived stress between prior to and following the study intervention of 14 weeks (Jan - May 2019)

intervention.description: Daily supplementation with omega-3 capsules (daily for 14 weeks). Each day: 3 capsules of 1.1g
Resistance exercise training in both supplementation conditions (3 times per week for 12 weeks).
Daily supplementation with placebo capsules (daily for 14 weeks). Each day: 3 capsules of 1.1g

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged >= 65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI < 20; BMI > 35
- regular NSAID intake in the last 3 months
- omega-3 supplementation in the last year
- regular resistance exercise in the last year
- cancer, liver and renal disease, unstable cardiovascular disease, musculoskeletal disease
- cognitive limitations that might interfere with the (adherence to) the intervention or with the testing of outcome parameters
- unstable body weight
- smoking
